body.p:
To His Excellency, Beriah Magoffin
Govenor of the Commonwealth of Ky.

Dear Sir -- We the undersigned citizens of Caldwell County Ky. have long known Thomas. B. Wadlington & he has ever been considered a good & true hearted citizen Known & noted for his industry & his peaceable & orderly conduct -- The difficulty in which he was engaged with Milton A. Cartwright, did not appear to us to be of his seeking, nor are we satisfied ^or do believe^ that the case was fairly presented to the jury, as it occured.

We hope your Excellency will review the case and give the poor man the benefit of every doubt, and we desire that his case may be judged of in mercy & regarded with favor, and that your Excellency will take into consideration every circumstance that ought to operate in his behalf. And we desire ^that^ your Excellency ^that^may be pursuaded that it is consistent with your duty to extend to him Executive Clemency and that his life may be spared, either by a full pardon or by a commutation of his punishment --

Jany 22 1861,
Yours respectfully
Jesse George
Peter. P. Baker
J M Harper
B. M, Starr
W, H, Carter
W, H. Cantrell
Bailous Phelps
